newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore weekly light distillate at two-year high.
newsitem.headline: Singapore weekly light distillate at two-year high.

text.p: Singapore light distillates stocks rose to a record 7.603 million barrels for the week ending April 16, up another 366,000 barrels, Singapore's Trade Development Board (TDB) showed.
Light distillates stocks have been rising steadily since the week ending March 12 and is now at a two-year high.
Light distillate comprise gasoline, reformate and naphtha.
Heavy residue stocks also gained 638,000 barrels to 10.692 million barrels.
They include HSFO, LSFO, LSWR and the straight-run atmospheric residue, but exclude bitumen.
Middle-distillate stocks also saw a massive build of one million barrels to 6.586 million barrels.
Middle distillates comprise jet, kerosene and gas oil.
